abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            Gujarat Emergency Earthquake Reconstruction Project
            describes negative environmental impacts and measures to be
            taken to mitigate them. An awareness campaign will be
            conducted so that excavated materials at each site will be
            managed properly, and storage/piling is done away from water
            bodies and drainage channels. Villages will be involved in
            the planning and site selection. No forestland, ecological
            protected areas, national parks, wildlife sanctuaries, or
            known habitats of flora/fauna will be acquired for public
            use, nor will environmental resources be overused as
            building materials. Pollution from and in the construction
            camps, loss of roadside vegetation, change in water
            availability, pollution of riverbeds (where bridges are
            built), management of borrow areas/quarries, and pollution
            from hot-mix and batching plants will be governed and/or
            alleviated using standard guidelines for
            mitigation/management of construction-related impacts in
            contractual provisions. All construction codes for buildings
            safety and worker safety will be strictly implemented.
            During construction activities, standard construction codes
            for minimizing environmental concerns will be used to offset
            increase of the catchment/submergence area due to increased
            dam height, and spillover and dust from haulage, storage,
            and handling of earth. The codes include provisions for
            efficient storage, haulage, handling of earthwork, dust
            suppression, and erosion control.
